name: quotation
explanation: entity 0 claims that formula 1 is true

name: causal implication
explanation: truth of formula 0 leads to truth of formula 1

name: desire
explanation: truth of formula 1 is desirable for entity 0

name: ought
explanation: formula 0 should be made true

name: possibility
explanation: formula 0 could be true

name: bad for concept
explanation: formula 1 is/would be bad for concept 0

name: good for concept
explanation: formula 1 is/would be good for concept 0

name: belief
explanation: entity 0 believes that formula 1 is true

name: option
explanation: entity 0 has the option to perform action 1

name: default implication
explanation: when formula 0 is true, formula 1 usually is also true

name: similarity
explanation: concept 0 is similar to concept 1

name: expressed preference
explanation: entity 1 prefers formula 2 over formula 0

name: entity's obligation
explanation: entity 0 should make formula 1 true

name: lying
explanation: entity 0 lies about formula 1

name: ad-hominem
explanation: entity 0 is morally bad and should be condemned

name: necessary condition
explanation: formula 0 is necessary for formula 1

name: implication
explanation: if formula 0 then formula 1

name: membership
explanation: entity 0 is part of entity 1

name: universal
explanation: all entities in entity 0 have property 1

name: position to know
explanation: entity 2 is part of entity 0 whose members know formula 1

name: negation
explanation: formula 0 is false

name: action execution
explanation: entity 0 executed action 1

name: weak universal
explanation: most entities in entity 0 have property 1

name: knowledge
explanation: entity 0 knows that formula 1 is true

name: necessary truth
explanation: formula 0 is necessarily true

name: permission
explanation: formula 0 would be morally acceptable

name: quotation of entity's obligation
template: Q_{{?0 : entity}} ({?1 : entity} \implies \downarrow x.,O (x stit ({?2 : formula}))
explanation: entity 0 states that everybody in entity 1 should make formula 2 true

name: warning
explanation: entity 0 warns of formula 1 being bad

name: some
explanation: some entities in 0 have property 1

name: nobody
explanation: nobody in 0 has property 1

name: warning of bad consequence
explanation: entity 0 warns that formula 1 has negative consequence formula 2

name: better
explanation: 1 is/would be at least as good as 0

name: better for concept
explanation: 1 is/would be at least as good for concept 2 as 0

name: good
explanation: 0 is/would be genereally good

name: bad
explanation: 0 is/would be generally bad

name: qualified desire
explanation: entity 2 is part of entity 0 whose members want formula 1

name: warning some
explanation: entity 0 warns that formula 2 is/would be bad for entity 1

name: warning of bad consequences for some
template: Q_{{?0 : entity}} ({?1 : formula} \mcauses {?2 : formula} \land badFor({?3 : entity},{?2})
explanation: entity 0 warns that formula 1 would cause formula 2 which would be bad for entity 3

name: cause of evil
explanation: formula 0 has/would have consequence formula 1 that is/would be bad

name: cause of evil for some
explanation: formula 0 has/would have consequence formula 1 that is/would be bad for entity/concept 2

name: intention
explanation: entity 0 is committed to make formula 1 true

name: intention to do
explanation: entity 0 intends to execute action 1

name: preamble
explanation: the preamble (for exporting)

name: explanation
explanation: 0 is the reason why 1 is true; note that 0 and 1 could be formulas talking about the past stating that something was the reason why something was the case at some point in time
1 is bad for entity 0
1 is good for entity 0

name: situation
explanation: in situation/point in time 0 1 was/is/would be the case; e.g. 'in the industrial revolution {1}'; so named points in time together with something that was or will be the case there

name: situation similarity
explanation: situations 0 and 1 are similar

name: bias
explanation: entity 0 is accused of being biased

name: unqualification
explanation: entity 0 is accused of being somehow unqualified to make meaningful contributions to the dialogue; e.g. 'idiot'

name: honesty
explanation: entity 0 is claimed to be honest w.r.t. formula 1 in the sense that they say what they believe

name: eventual result
explanation: by executing action 0 truth of 1 would be eventually achieved

name: DES
template: [{?0 : entities};{{?1 : \text{list of lists of }actions}} : {?2 : entities}]({?3 : formula})
explanation: the entities 0 can collaborate to enforce truth of 3 as long as entities 2 execute one of the (joint) actions from 1

name: possible causation claim
explanation: entity 0 claims that 1 might cause 2 to be true

name: unary preference
explanation: entity 0 prefers formula 1 being true over it being false

name: unknown
explanation: uncategorized queries
